pr_title: Allows to log error rather than throwing exceptions when there is an IIDM-XML version incompatibility during export

timeline.message:
Add in ExportOptions the possibility to chose the behavior when there is an IIDM version incompatibility

Signed-off-by: RALAMBOTIANA MIORA <miora.ralambotiana@rte-france.com>

Add the option in XMLExporter

Signed-off-by: RALAMBOTIANA MIORA <miora.ralambotiana@rte-france.com>

Fix code smells

Signed-off-by: RALAMBOTIANA MIORA <miora.ralambotiana@rte-france.com>

timeline.bodyText: I'm not totally sure this is OK. The new shunt API wasn't available before XIIDM v1.3. If the model is non-linear, should we throw an exception instead? From my point of view, it's not equivalent and should not be supported
timeline.author: mathbagu

timeline.bodyText: If we encounter a non linear model, and should export it in a previous version, we silently ignore it. Should we throw an exception? The exported network is not equivalent then.
timeline.author: mathbagu

replies.bodyText: No, we don't, a log is made (l.51) but it is considered a shunt with a unique section which has the current susceptance
replies.author: miovd

timeline.message:
Add generation fields in backward best effort

Signed-off-by: RALAMBOTIANA MIORA <miora.ralambotiana@rte-france.com>

Correction: current section for non linear shunt is always 1

Signed-off-by: RALAMBOTIANA MIORA <miora.ralambotiana@rte-france.com>

Add tests and javadoc

Signed-off-by: RALAMBOTIANA MIORA <miora.ralambotiana@rte-france.com>

timeline.bodyText: There is no good reason to create a supplier if you always call the get() method. I would replace it by a simple string and check if ERROR level is enabled
timeline.author: mathbagu

timeline.message:
Reviewer's comment: not using a supplier, only check error level is enabled
